description: Stereophonic, a new play on Broadway with music by Arcade Fire's Will Butler, tracks the volatile creation of a rock and roll album over the course of a year in the 1970s.
title: A new play peers into a band's life, from the inside

description: Israel and Iran seem to be downplaying the attack, the latest in a series of retaliatory strikes between the two. Analysts say that could be a sign of the de-escalation world leaders are calling for.
title: What we know so far about Israel's strike on Iran — and what could happen next

description: The Jinx ended with Robert Durst, a wealthy man suspected of multiple murders, making self-incriminating statements on a hot mic. Part Two picks up where the original left off: arrest and conviction.
title: The first 'Jinx' ended with a hot mic murder admission. 'Part Two' shocks as well

description: A new study finds that in news stories about scientific research, U.S. media were less likely to mention a scientist if they had an East Asian or African name, as compared to one with an Anglo name.
title: Which scientists get mentioned in the news? Mostly ones with Anglo names, says study

description: Tester is the last Democrat holding statewide office as Republicans have dominated recent elections in Montana. He's carved out an identity as a moderate and he hopes that will win him another term.
title: Democratic Sen. Jon Tester hopes to secure another win in deep-red Montana

description: With The Tortured Poets Department, the defining pop star of her era has made an album as messy and confrontational as any good girl's work can get.
title: Taylor Swift's 'Tortured Poets' is written in blood

description: There are also reports of explosions in Iraq and Syria. The extent of Israel's strikes weren't yet clear.
title: Israel launches missile strikes into Iran in response to Tehran's attack Sunday
